description: This module provides students with an in-depth understanding of the principles and skills to address the social, psychological and environmental factors influencing behaviour and behavioural change. Upon completion of this module, students will be able to interpret published research on behavioural interventions and apply commonly used behavioural theories and models to change and evaluate behaviour at the individual, group and community level for the development of effective public health promotion interventions and policies.
title: Advanced Health Behaviour and Communication
